page.title: 14Local History 2
page.content: Local octogenarian,{Mr.Frank Nute} ,remembers Tintagel as it was in his childhood.The present school was opened,just before the 1st World War, when Mr.Nute was a school boy. Previously the school was in the Old Schoolroom in the village.The first headmaster of the present school was a bearded man called Mr.White.Each day mothers would come at 11.45 am,bang on the window andthe boys would be let out of school to run to the quarry on the cliff with their fathers' lunches - a pasty and a jar of tea.There was also a copper and silver mine at Castle Cove at this time.Mr.Nute's first job was as a carpenters apprentice in Treknow.Although Tintagel has changed greatly in his lifetime,the old local families of the Chillcotts and Dangars still live in the village.
